4742.verse-english: Indeed, the punishment of your Lord will occur.

clauses-english.clause: the punishment of your Lord will occur.

4743.verse-english: Of it there is no preventer.

clauses-english.clause: Of it there is no preventer.

4744.verse-english: On the Day the heaven will sway with circular motion

clauses-english.clause: On the Day the heaven will sway with circular motion

4745.verse-english: And the mountains will pass on, departing -

clauses-english.clause: And the mountains will pass on,

4746.verse-english: Then woe, that Day, to the deniers,

4747.verse-english: Who are in [empty] discourse amusing themselves.

clauses-english.clause: Who are in [empty] discourse amusing themselves.

4748.verse-arabic: يَوْمَ يُدَعُّونَ إِلَىٰ نَارِ جَهَنَّمَ دَعًّا
4748.verse-english: The Day they are thrust toward the fire of Hell with a [violent] thrust, [its angels will say],

clauses-english.clause: The Day they are thrust toward the fire of Hell with a [violent] thrust,

4749.verse-arabic: هَٰذِهِ النَّارُ الَّتِي كُنتُم بِهَا تُكَذِّبُونَ
4749.verse-english: "This is the Fire which you used to deny.

clauses-arabic.clause: هَٰذِهِ النَّارُ الَّتِي كُنتُم بِهَا تُكَذِّبُونَ

clauses-english.clause: "This is the Fire which you used to deny.

4750.verse-arabic: أَفَسِحْرٌ هَٰذَا أَمْ أَنتُمْ لَا تُبْصِرُونَ
4750.verse-english: Then is this magic, or do you not see?

4751.verse-arabic: اصْلَوْهَا فَاصْبِرُوا أَوْ لَا تَصْبِرُوا سَوَاءٌ عَلَيْكُمْ ۖ إِنَّمَا تُجْزَوْنَ مَا كُنتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ
4751.verse-english: [Enter to] burn therein; then be patient or impatient - it is all the same for you. You are only being recompensed [for] what you used to do."

clauses-english.clause: it is all the same for you.
You are only being recompensed [for] what you used to do.

4752.verse-english: Indeed, the righteous will be in gardens and pleasure,

clauses-english.clause: the righteous will be in gardens and pleasure,

4753.verse-arabic: فَاكِهِينَ بِمَا آتَاهُمْ رَبُّهُمْ وَوَقَاهُمْ رَبُّهُمْ عَذَابَ الْجَحِيمِ
4753.verse-english: Enjoying what their Lord has given them, and their Lord protected them from the punishment of Hellfire.

clauses-english.clause: Enjoying what their Lord has given them,
and their Lord protected them from the punishment of Hellfire.

4754.verse-arabic: كُلُوا وَاشْرَبُوا هَنِيئًا بِمَا كُنتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ
4754.verse-english: [They will be told], "Eat and drink in satisfaction for what you used to do."

clauses-english.clause: "Eat and drink in satisfaction for what you used to do.

4755.verse-arabic: مُتَّكِئِينَ عَلَىٰ سُرُرٍ مَّصْفُوفَةٍ ۖ وَزَوَّجْنَاهُم بِحُورٍ عِينٍ
4755.verse-english: They will be reclining on thrones lined up, and We will marry them to fair women with large, [beautiful] eyes.

clauses-english.clause: They will be reclining on thrones lined up,
and We will marry them to fair women with large,

4756.verse-arabic: وَالَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَاتَّبَعَتْهُمْ ذُرِّيَّتُهُم بِإِيمَانٍ أَلْحَقْنَا بِهِمْ ذُرِّيَّتَهُمْ وَمَا أَلَتْنَاهُم مِّنْ عَمَلِهِم مِّن شَيْءٍ ۚ كُلُّ امْرِئٍ بِمَا كَسَبَ رَهِينٌ
4756.verse-english: And those who believed and whose descendants followed them in faith - We will join with them their descendants, and We will not deprive them of anything of their deeds. Every person, for what he earned, is retained.

clauses-english.clause: And those who believed and whose descendants followed them in faith -
We will join with them their descendants,
and We will not deprive them of anything of their deeds.

4757.verse-english: And We will provide them with fruit and meat from whatever they desire.

clauses-english.clause: And We will provide them with fruit and meat from whatever they desire.

4758.verse-arabic: يَتَنَازَعُونَ فِيهَا كَأْسًا لَّا لَغْوٌ فِيهَا وَلَا تَأْثِيمٌ
4758.verse-english: They will exchange with one another a cup [of wine] wherein [results] no ill speech or commission of sin.

clauses-arabic.clause: يَتَنَازَعُونَ فِيهَا كَأْسًا لَّا لَغْوٌ فِيهَا وَلَا تَأْثِيمٌ

clauses-english.clause: They will exchange with one another a cup [of wine] wherein [results] no ill speech or commission of sin.

4759.verse-arabic: ۞ وَيَطُوفُ عَلَيْهِمْ غِلْمَانٌ لَّهُمْ كَأَنَّهُمْ لُؤْلُؤٌ مَّكْنُونٌ
4759.verse-english: There will circulate among them [servant] boys [especially] for them, as if they were pearls well-protected.

clauses-english.clause: There will circulate among them [servant] boys [especially] for them,
as if they were pearls well-

4760.verse-english: And they will approach one another, inquiring of each other.

clauses-english.clause: And they will approach one another,

4761.verse-arabic: قَالُوا إِنَّا كُنَّا قَبْلُ فِي أَهْلِنَا مُشْفِقِينَ
4761.verse-english: They will say, "Indeed, we were previously among our people fearful [of displeasing Allah].

clauses-english.clause: we were previously among our people fearful [of displeasing God].

4762.verse-arabic: فَمَنَّ اللَّهُ عَلَيْنَا وَوَقَانَا عَذَابَ السَّمُومِ
4762.verse-english: So Allah conferred favor upon us and protected us from the punishment of the Scorching Fire.

clauses-arabic.clause: فَمَنَّ اللَّهُ عَلَيْنَا وَوَقَانَا عَذَابَ السَّمُومِ

clauses-english.clause: So God conferred favor upon us and protected us from the punishment of the Scorching Fire.

4763.verse-arabic: إِنَّا كُنَّا مِن قَبْلُ نَدْعُوهُ ۖ إِنَّهُ هُوَ الْبَرُّ الرَّحِيمُ
4763.verse-english: Indeed, we used to supplicate Him before. Indeed, it is He who is the Beneficent, the Merciful."

clauses-english.clause: we used to supplicate Him before.
it is He who is the Beneficent,

4764.verse-arabic: فَذَكِّرْ فَمَا أَنتَ بِنِعْمَتِ رَبِّكَ بِكَاهِنٍ وَلَا مَجْنُونٍ
4764.verse-english: So remind [O Muhammad], for you are not, by the favor of your Lord, a soothsayer or a madman.

clauses-english.clause: by the favor of your Lord,

4765.verse-arabic: أَمْ يَقُولُونَ شَاعِرٌ نَّتَرَبَّصُ بِهِ رَيْبَ الْمَنُونِ
4765.verse-english: Or do they say [of you], "A poet for whom we await a misfortune of time?"

clauses-english.clause: "A poet for whom we await a misfortune of time?

4766.verse-arabic: قُلْ تَرَبَّصُوا فَإِنِّي مَعَكُم مِّنَ الْمُتَرَبِّصِينَ
4766.verse-english: Say, "Wait, for indeed I am, with you, among the waiters."

4767.verse-arabic: أَمْ تَأْمُرُهُمْ أَحْلَامُهُم بِهَٰذَا ۚ أَمْ هُمْ قَوْمٌ طَاغُونَ
4767.verse-english: Or do their minds command them to [say] this, or are they a transgressing people?

clauses-english.clause: Or do their minds command them to [say] this,
or are they a transgressing people?

4768.verse-arabic: أَمْ يَقُولُونَ تَقَوَّلَهُ ۚ بَل لَّا يُؤْمِنُونَ
4768.verse-english: Or do they say, "He has made it up"? Rather, they do not believe.

4769.verse-arabic: فَلْيَأْتُوا بِحَدِيثٍ مِّثْلِهِ إِن كَانُوا صَادِقِينَ
4769.verse-english: Then let them produce a statement like it, if they should be truthful.

clauses-english.clause: Then let them produce a statement like it,

4770.verse-arabic: أَمْ خُلِقُوا مِنْ غَيْرِ شَيْءٍ أَمْ هُمُ الْخَالِقُونَ
4770.verse-english: Or were they created by nothing, or were they the creators [of themselves]?

clauses-english.clause: Or were they created by nothing,
or were they the creators [of themselves]?

4771.verse-arabic: أَمْ خَلَقُوا السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضَ ۚ بَل لَّا يُوقِنُونَ
4771.verse-english: Or did they create the heavens and the earth? Rather, they are not certain.

clauses-english.clause: Or did they create the heavens and the earth?

4772.verse-arabic: أَمْ عِندَهُمْ خَزَائِنُ رَبِّكَ أَمْ هُمُ الْمُصَيْطِرُونَ
4772.verse-english: Or have they the depositories [containing the provision] of your Lord? Or are they the controllers [of them]?

clauses-english.clause: Or have they the depositories [containing the provision] of your Lord?
Or are they the controllers [of them]?

4773.verse-arabic: أَمْ لَهُمْ سُلَّمٌ يَسْتَمِعُونَ فِيهِ ۖ فَلْيَأْتِ مُسْتَمِعُهُم بِسُلْطَانٍ مُّبِينٍ
4773.verse-english: Or have they a stairway [into the heaven] upon which they listen? Then let their listener produce a clear authority.

clauses-english.clause: Or have they a stairway [into the heaven] upon which they listen?
Then let their listener produce a clear authority.

4774.verse-english: Or has He daughters while you have sons?

clauses-english.clause: Or has He daughters while you have sons?

4775.verse-arabic: أَمْ تَسْأَلُهُمْ أَجْرًا فَهُم مِّن مَّغْرَمٍ مُّثْقَلُونَ
4775.verse-english: Or do you, [O Muhammad], ask of them a payment, so they are by debt burdened down?

clauses-english.clause: so they are by debt burdened down?

4776.verse-english: Or have they [knowledge of] the unseen, so they write [it] down?

clauses-english.clause: Or have they [knowledge of] the unseen,

4777.verse-arabic: أَمْ يُرِيدُونَ كَيْدًا ۖ فَالَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا هُمُ الْمَكِيدُونَ
4777.verse-english: Or do they intend a plan? But those who disbelieve - they are the object of a plan.

clauses-english.clause: Or do they intend a plan?
they are the object of a plan.

4778.verse-arabic: أَمْ لَهُمْ إِلَٰهٌ غَيْرُ اللَّهِ ۚ سُبْحَانَ اللَّهِ عَمَّا يُشْرِكُونَ
4778.verse-english: Or have they a deity other than Allah? Exalted is Allah above whatever they associate with Him.

clauses-english.clause: Or have they a deity other than God?
Exalted is God above whatever they associate with Him.

4779.verse-arabic: وَإِن يَرَوْا كِسْفًا مِّنَ السَّمَاءِ سَاقِطًا يَقُولُوا سَحَابٌ مَّرْكُومٌ
4779.verse-english: And if they were to see a fragment from the sky falling, they would say, "[It is merely] clouds heaped up."

clauses-english.clause: And if they were to see a fragment from the sky falling,

4780.verse-arabic: فَذَرْهُمْ حَتَّىٰ يُلَاقُوا يَوْمَهُمُ الَّذِي فِيهِ يُصْعَقُونَ
4780.verse-english: So leave them until they meet their Day in which they will be struck insensible -

clauses-arabic.clause: فَذَرْهُمْ حَتَّىٰ يُلَاقُوا يَوْمَهُمُ الَّذِي فِيهِ يُصْعَقُونَ

clauses-english.clause: So leave them until they meet their Day in which they will be struck insensible -

4781.verse-arabic: يَوْمَ لَا يُغْنِي عَنْهُمْ كَيْدُهُمْ شَيْئًا وَلَا هُمْ يُنصَرُونَ
4781.verse-english: The Day their plan will not avail them at all, nor will they be helped.

clauses-english.clause: The Day their plan will not avail them at all,

4782.verse-arabic: وَإِنَّ لِلَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوا عَذَابًا دُونَ ذَٰلِكَ وَلَٰكِنَّ أَكْثَرَهُمْ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ
4782.verse-english: And indeed, for those who have wronged is a punishment before that, but most of them do not know.

clauses-english.clause: for those who have wronged is a punishment before that,
but most of them do not know.

4783.verse-arabic: وَاصْبِرْ لِحُكْمِ رَبِّكَ فَإِنَّكَ بِأَعْيُنِنَا ۖ وَسَبِّحْ بِحَمْدِ رَبِّكَ حِينَ تَقُومُ
4783.verse-english: And be patient, [O Muhammad], for the decision of your Lord, for indeed, you are in Our eyes. And exalt [Allah] with praise of your Lord when you arise.

clauses-english.clause: for the decision of your Lord,
And exalt [God] with praise of your Lord when you arise.

4784.verse-english: And in a part of the night exalt Him and after [the setting of] the stars.

clauses-english.clause: And in a part of the night exalt Him and after [the setting of] the stars.
